Name: indexrelid
Description: The OID of the pg_class entry for this index

Name: indrelid
Description: The OID of the pg_class entry for the table this\n index is for

Name: indproc
Description: The function's OID if this is a functional index,\n else zero

Name: indkey
Description: This is a vector (array) of up to INDEX_MAX_KEYS values that indicate which\n table columns this index pertains to. For example a value of 1 3 would mean that the first and the third column make up the index key. For a functional index, these columns are the inputs to the function, and the function's return value is the index key.

Name: indclass
Description: For each column in the index key this contains a\n reference to the "operator class" to use. See pg_opclass for details.

Name: indisclustered
Description: If true, the table was last clustered on this\n index.

Name: indisunique
Description: If true, this is a unique index.

Name: indisprimary
Description: If true, this index represents the primary key of the\n table. (indisunique should always be true when this is true.)

Name: indpred
Description: Expression tree (in the form of a nodeToString\n representation) for partial index predicate. Empty string if not a partial index.
